intro: Hieracium subsecundum, commonly known as the bent-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are deeply lobed or divided. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium subsecundum is often found in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it can spread through rhizomes and seeds.
